predJson.name: Anti-VEGF intravitreal injections and kidney failure (on-treatment + ITT sensitivity)

targetCohort.name: Intravitreal anti-VEGF new users (monthly; ranibizumab/aflibercept/bevacizumab; >=3 months; adults; >=365d prior observation; blinding disease)

comparatorCohort.name: Active comparator intravitreal anti-VEGF new users (ranibizumab vs aflibercept vs bevacizumab comparisons)

outcomeCohort.name: Kidney failure / end-stage kidney disease (administrative code-only phenotype used in primary analysis)

timeAtRisks.description: On-treatment TAR (primary): from after 3rd injection until end of continuous exposure (gap >180d defines end)
Intent-to-treat TAR (sensitivity): from cohort entry through end of observation (no censoring at treatment end/switch)

psSettings.description: 1:1 propensity score matching (large-scale PS with L1 regularization)

predJson.name: ACE inhibitors vs ARBs / Thiazide diuretics and incident schizophrenia (active-comparator new-user; AT and ITT sensitivity)

targetCohort.name: New users of ACE inhibitors (adult; 1y prior observation; exclusions per protocol)

comparatorCohort.name: New users of ARBs OR thiazide/thiazide-like diuretics (adult; 1y prior observation; exclusions per protocol)

outcomeCohort.name: Schizophrenia (primary: first diagnosis with restricted confirmation criteria)

negativeControlConceptSet.name: Falsification endpoints / negative control outcomes (26 outcomes)

conceptsToInclude.name: All available baseline demographics, conditions, drugs, and procedures (large-scale PS; >10,000 covariates)

timeAtRisks.description: As-treated (AT): from day 1 after initiation until treatment end (allow 30-day refill gap) / censor at outcome or observation end
Intention-to-treat (ITT) sensitivity: from day 1 after initiation through end of observation (regardless of discontinuation)

predJson.name: New-user active-comparator DOAC head-to-head study in AF (OHDSI IQVIA network, 2010-2019)

targetCohort.name: New users of index DOAC (pairwise head-to-head comparison) in AF

comparatorCohort.name: New users of comparator DOAC (pairwise head-to-head comparison) in AF

outcomeCohort.name: Composite ischemic stroke and systemic embolism

negativeControlConceptSet.name: Negative control outcomes (49 outcomes; data-rich algorithm)

conceptsToInclude.name: All baseline covariates identified in the 365 days prior to and including index date (data-driven large-scale PS)

timeAtRisks.description: On-treatment (censor at discontinuation with 90-day permissible gaps; censor at switch; censor at death/end of study)
Intention-to-treat sensitivity (do not censor at discontinuation or switching)

psSettings.description: Propensity score matching sensitivity (variable-ratio matching; ATT)

predJson.name: COVID-19 Estimation Famotidine (Premier Hospital Database) - Prevalent-user comparative cohort

targetCohort.name: Famotidine users on day of admission among hospitalized COVID-19 patients

comparatorCohort.name: Active comparator users on day of admission among hospitalized COVID-19 patients (PPI or hydroxychloroquine; run separately)

outcomeCohort.name: Death or intensive services (mechanical ventilation, tracheostomy, or ECMO) during hospitalization

negativeControlConceptSet.name: Negative control outcomes concept set (not specified)

conceptsToInclude.name: All observed baseline covariates (demographics incl. gender/age/index month; all conditions in prior 30 days or on admission; exclude features <0.1% prevalence during PS fitting)

timeAtRisks.description: ITT: start day 1 after admission, end at 30 days after admission (or earlier outcome/LTFU handled by data)

predJson.name: Acid-suppressant use and COVID-19 outcomes (HIRA OMOP-CDM v5, South Korea)

timeAtRisks.description: On-treatment (start day after index; end at cohort end)

predJson.name: DOACs vs warfarin and severe uterine bleeding in adult women (new-user cohort; AF/VTE indications)

conceptsToInclude.name: All available baseline covariates (demographics, conditions, drugs, procedures, risk scores) in prior 183 days on/before index

timeAtRisks.description: Primary on-treatment TAR: day 1 after index to cohort end (persistent exposure; database observation end; or study end)
Sensitivity TAR 1: on-treatment with extended permissible gap (30 days) and no appended days; day 1 after index to cohort end
Sensitivity TAR 2 (ITT): day 1 after index to end of observation or study end (implemented as cohort end)

psSettings.description: Primary PS: 1:1 matching, greedy, caliper 0.2 SD on logit(PS)
Sensitivity PS: variable-ratio matching up to 1:100, greedy, caliper 0.2 SD on logit(PS)

predJson.name: Comparative effectiveness of Cu IUD vs LNG-IUS on high-grade cervical neoplasm incidence (CUIMC OMOP-CDM v5.2)

targetCohort.name: Cu IUD users (first IUD placement; female <=45; >=365d prior observation; no prior IUD; no prior endometrial/cervical neoplasm; no both-device use)

comparatorCohort.name: LNG-IUS users (first IUD placement; female <=45; >=365d prior observation; no prior IUD; no prior endometrial/cervical neoplasm; no both-device use)

negativeControlConceptSet.name: Negative control outcomes (123 diagnoses unrelated to IUD exposure)

timeAtRisks.description: Primary TAR: 30 days to 15 years after IUD placement (any-use; follow until outcome or observation end)
Subgroup TAR: diagnoses occurring >=1 year after IUD placement (sensitivity/subgroup)

predJson.name: LEGEND-T2DM: Second-line antihyperglycemic agents in T2DM with established CVD (new-user, on-treatment, PS stratification/matching, calibrated with negative controls)

targetCohort.name: New users of SGLT2i or GLP-1 RA or DPP4i or SU among T2DM + established CVD on metformin monotherapy

comparatorCohort.name: Active comparator new users of another second-line class (SGLT2i vs GLP-1 RA vs DPP4i vs SU) among T2DM + established CVD on metformin monotherapy

outcomeCohort.name: 3-point MACE (acute MI, stroke, sudden cardiac death)
4-point MACE (acute MI, stroke, sudden cardiac death, hospitalization for heart failure)

conceptsToInclude.name: All baseline covariates (data-driven large-scale PS: demographics, comorbidities, concomitant medications, health care utilization)

timeAtRisks.description: On-treatment: from treatment initiation to treatment discontinuation (continuous exposure allowing <30-day gaps)

psSettings.description: PS stratification (preferred when balance achieved; SMD < 0.15)
PS variable-ratio matching (used when stratification does not achieve balance; SMD < 0.15)

comparatorCohort.name: Adult new users of other H2RAs (famotidine/roxatidine/lafutidine) with >=365d washout; exclude cimetidine/nizatidine; exclude prior cancer

outcomeCohort.name: Any cancer excluding nonmelanoma skin cancer (primary)
Any cancer including nonmelanoma skin cancer and excluding thyroid cancer (secondary)
Lip, oral cavity, and pharynx cancer
Gall bladder and biliary tract cancer

negativeControlConceptSet.name: Negative control outcomes (119 outcomes; expected true HR=1)

conceptsToInclude.name: Large-scale baseline covariates: demographics (age/sex/race/ethnicity), index month/year, all conditions, drugs, procedures, Charlson Comorbidity Index in prior 365d

timeAtRisks.description: Primary: ITT with 1-year lag (follow until observation end; start 365d after index)
Sensitivity: ITT (follow until observation end; start 1d after index)
Sensitivity: During treatment (on-treatment; start 1d after index; end at cohort end)
Sensitivity: During treatment with 1-year lag (start 365d after index; end at cohort end)

psSettings.description: Primary: 1:1 PS matching (caliper 0.2 SD on standardized logit PS)
Sensitivity: Variable-ratio PS matching (up to 1:10; caliper 0.2 SD standardized logit)

outcomeCohort.name: Outcome of interest (AESI; e.g., Guillain-Barr syndrome)

TAR 2: days 1-28 post vaccination
TAR 3: days 1-42 post vaccination
TAR 4: days 1-90 post vaccination
TAR 5 (anaphylaxis sensitivity): days 0-2 post vaccination

comparatorCohort.name: New users of comparator T2D medication (dulaglutide/exenatide/empagliflozin/sitagliptin/glipizide)

NAION (specific definition: confirmatory 2nd ischemic optic neuropathy diagnosis code within 90 days; excludes traumatic optic neuropathy and 2 GCA codes)

negativeControlConceptSet.name: Negative control outcomes concept set (97 outcomes)

conceptsToInclude.name: All baseline covariates (large-scale PS: demographics, conditions, drugs, procedures, etc.)

timeAtRisks.description: On-treatment: from initiation until end of continuous exposure (allow 30-day gap) or observation end

predJson.name: Stroke risk in elderly new users of antipsychotics (MDCR OMOP-CDM)

targetCohort.name: New users of typical antipsychotics (>=65y, 183d washout/clean window)

comparatorCohort.name: New users of atypical antipsychotics (>=65y, 183d washout/clean window)

timeAtRisks.description: On-treatment: day after index until cohort end

psSettings.description: Sentinel PS replication: 1:1 match, caliper 0.05 on PS scale
Adapted PS strategy: variable-ratio up to 1:10, caliper 0.2 SD logit(PS)

predJson.name: Ticagrelor vs clopidogrel after first PCI for ACS (OMOP-CDM, distributed network)

targetCohort.name: Ticagrelor users (ascertained within 7 days before index PCI) after first PCI for ACS, adults >=20y, >=1y prior observation

comparatorCohort.name: Clopidogrel users (ascertained within 7 days before index PCI) after first PCI for ACS, adults >=20y, >=1y prior observation

outcomeCohort.name: Net adverse clinical events (NACE): recurrent AMI, revascularization, ischemic stroke, hemorrhagic stroke, or gastrointestinal bleeding
Composite ischemic events: recurrent AMI, revascularization, or ischemic stroke
Composite hemorrhagic events: hemorrhagic stroke or gastrointestinal bleeding
Cardiovascular-related mortality (post hoc; available in Optum EHR and HIRA)
MACE: cardiovascular mortality, recurrent AMI, and stroke (post hoc; available in Optum EHR and HIRA)

negativeControlConceptSet.name: Falsification endpoints (96 negative control outcomes; e.g., chalazion, pneumothorax)

conceptsToInclude.name: All available baseline demographics and medical/medication/procedure/device history (data-driven PS with >10,000 covariates; plus race and labs where available)

timeAtRisks.description: Primary ITT-like: day 1-365 after PCI
Sensitivity: 5-year fixed follow-up
Sensitivity: on-treatment (from day 1 after index until cohort end/persistent exposure end)
Sensitivity blanking period: exclude outcomes in first 28 days (start day 29 through day 365)
Sensitivity blanking period + 5-year follow-up (start day 29 through 5 years)
Sensitivity blanking period + on-treatment (start day 29 through cohort end)

predJson.name: Tramadol vs Codeine and Hip Fracture (Retrospective Comparative Cohort; OT and ITT TARs)

conceptsToExclude.name: Exclude covariates with prevalence <0.1% in combined T/C (implemented outside spec)

Intent-to-treat (ITT): index to end of observation (death/exit), censored at outcome
